newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Prisoner dies in explosion in Colombian jail.
newsitem.headline: Prisoner dies in explosion in Colombian jail.

text.p: A prisoner in Bogota's high- security jail was killed when a bomb he was handling exploded, a prison spokesman said on Sunday.
Another inmate was seriously injured in the explosion.
The blast occurred late on Saturday in an area of the La Picota jail adjoining the wing where the Cali drug cartel bosses, the Rodriguez Orejuela brothers, are imprisoned.
The man who died was William Infante, 33, the contract killer who murdered the leader of the left-wing Patriotic Union (UP) party in 1987, the prison spokesman said.
"There was an incident in which a prisoner was handling explosives. We do not yet know exactly what type of explosive it was. The prisoner died in the blast," the spokesman said.
He said it was not yet clear how Infante, serving a 24-year jail term, had obtained the explosives.

According to Colombia's leading El Tiempo newspaper, Infante murdered UP leader Jaime Pardo Leal on the orders of the late drug trafficker Gonzalo Rodriguez Gacha, a henchman of cocaine kingpin Pablo Escobar, former head of the Medellin cartel.
